chapter.title: Installing and Setting Up an ⪪ Server on the &admserv; (Optional)

abstract.para: One way to provide the repositories needed to set up the nodes in &cloud; is to install a &smtool; (⪪) server on the &admserv;, and then mirror all repositories from &scc; via this server. Installing an ⪪ server on the &admserv; is optional. If your organization already provides an ⪪ server or a &susemgr; server that can be accessed from the &admserv;, skip this step.

important.title: Use of ⪪ Server and Ports
important.para: When installing an ⪪ server on the &admserv;, use it exclusively for &productname;. To use the ⪪ server for other products, run it outside of &productname;. Make sure it can be accessed from the &admserv; for mirroring the repositories needed for &productname;.
When the ⪪ server is installed on the &admserv;, &crow; provides the mirrored repositories on port 8091.

sect1.title: ⪪ Installation
⪪ Configuration
sect1.para: No matter whether the ⪪ server was installed during the initial installation or in the running system, it needs to be configured with the following steps.

note.title: Prerequisites
note.para: To configure the ⪪ server, a SUSE account is required. If you do not have such an account, register at . All products and extensions for which you want to mirror updates with the ⪪ server should be registered at the &scc; ().

step.para: Configuring the ⪪ server requires you to have your mirroring credentials (user name and password) and your registration e-mail address at hand. To access them, proceed as follows:
Open a Web browser and log in to the &scc; at .
Click your name to see the e-mail address which you have registered.
Click Organization Organization Credentials to obtain your mirroring credentials (user name and password).
Start &yast; Network Services SMT Configuration Wizard.
Activate Enable Subscription Management Tool Service (SMT).
Enter the Customer Center Configuration data as follows:

simplelist.member: Use Custom Server: Do not activate this option
User: The user name you retrieved from the &scc;
Password: The password you retrieved from the &scc;

step.para: Check your input with Test. If the test does not return success, check the credentials you entered.
Enter the e-mail address you retrieved from the &scc; at SCC E-Mail Used for Registration.
Your SMT Server URL shows the HTTP address of your server. Usually it should not be necessary to change it.
Select Next to proceed to step two of the SMT Configuration Wizard.
Enter a Database Password for SMT User and confirm it by entering it once again.
Enter one or more e-mail addresses to which ⪪ status reports are sent by selecting Add.

Select Next to save your ⪪ configuration. When setting up the database you will be prompted for the MariaDB root password. If you have not already created one then create it in this step. Note that this is the global MariaDB root password, not the database password for the SMT user you specified before.

The ⪪ server requires a server certificate at /etc/pki/trust/anchors/YaST-CA.pem. Choose Run CA Management, provide a password and choose Next to create such a certificate. If your organization already provides a CA certificate, Skip this step and import the certificate via YaST Security and Users CA Management after the ⪪ configuration is done. See
for more information.
After you complete your configuration a synchronization check with the &scc; will run, which may take several minutes.

sect1.title: Setting up Repository Mirroring on the ⪪ Server
sect1.para: The final step in setting up the ⪪ server is configuring it to mirror the repositories needed for &cloud;. The ⪪ server mirrors the repositories from the &scc;. Make sure to have the appropriate subscriptions registered in &scc; with the same e-mail address you specified when configuring ⪪. For details on the required subscriptions refer to .

sect2.title: Adding Mandatory Repositories
sect2.screen: for REPO in &sle_repo;-{Pool,Updates} &cloud_repo;-{Pool,Updates}; do smt-repos $REPO &smt_os; -e done

sect2.title: Adding Optional Repositories
sect2.para: The following optional repositories for storage:

listitem.para: The &storage; repositories are needed if you plan to use an external &ceph; with &cloud;. Run the following commands as user &rootuser; to add them to the list of mirrored repositories:
listitem.screen: for REPO in &ses_repo;-{Pool,Updates}; do smt-repos $REPO &smt_os; -e done
